key_title: Key to the species of Marsilea

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants
Key to the genera of Marsileaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaflets uniform in colour; stipe without swelling below leaflets; sporocarp bean-shaped, with 1 or 2 basal teeth
Leaflets with two colour zones, shiny; stipe swollen just below leaflets; sporocarp globose, lacking teeth
Leaflets narrowly to broadly obovate-cuneate, more than 5 mm broad, outer margins rounded and entire to deeply scalloped; sporocarp with 2 basal teeth

Leaflets oblanceolate-cuneate, almost all less than 5 mm broad, outer margins straight to slightly rounded and entire, unequally arranged, more or less paired; sporocarp with 1 prominent basal tooth, rarely with second smaller tooth below
Stalk of sporocarp longer than sporocarp; upper basal tooth of sporocarp smaller than lower
Stalk of sporocarp shorter than sporocarp; basal teeth of sporocarp equally prominent
